definitions: thick main stem of a tree from ground to first major branches
examples: The ancient oak had a massive bole measuring ten feet around
Lightning had scarred the bole but the tree survived

definitions: native or inhabitant of Bolivia, a landlocked country in South America
examples: The Bolivian artist displayed her paintings at the international gallery
Many Bolivians speak both Spanish and indigenous languages fluently

definitions: Hindi-language film industry based in Mumbai, known for musical productions and colorful cinematography
examples: Bollywood produces more films annually than Hollywood does
The new Bollywood blockbuster features elaborate dance sequences

definitions: large smoked sausage made from various seasoned meats
historic city in northern Italy known for medieval architecture
examples: She made sandwiches with sliced bologna and mustard
The deli offers both regular and garlic bologna varieties
Bologna hosts Europe's oldest university founded in 1088
The red brick towers dominate Bologna's historic skyline

definitions: member of the Russian Social Democratic Party that seized power in the 1917 Revolution
examples: The Bolsheviks overthrew the provisional government in October 1917
Lenin emerged as the leader of the Bolshevik faction

definitions: political doctrine and practice of the Bolsheviks emphasizing revolutionary overthrow of capitalism
examples: Bolshevism spread rapidly among Russian workers and soldiers
Critics argued that Bolshevism threatened democratic institutions worldwide

definitions: red or white wine produced in the Bordeaux region of France
major port city in southwestern France famous for wine production
examples: The vintage Bordeaux paired perfectly with the steak dinner
She ordered a bottle of white Bordeaux for the celebration
Bordeaux attracts millions of wine tourists every year
The historic center of Bordeaux features elegant eighteenth-century architecture

definitions: native or inhabitant of Borneo, the third-largest island in the world
examples: The Bornean guide led us through the ancient rainforest
Many Borneans still practice traditional customs and ceremonies today

definitions: large smooth rounded rock typically found isolated or in groups
examples: Climbers practiced their techniques on the massive granite boulder
The glacier left numerous boulders scattered across the valley

definitions: money offered as reward for capture or achievement
generous supply or yield especially from nature
examples: The sheriff posted a thousand dollar bounty for the outlaw
Bounty hunters tracked fugitives across the western frontier
The autumn harvest produced a bounty of fresh vegetables
Nature's bounty sustained the coastal community for generations

definitions: American whiskey distilled primarily from corn and aged in charred oak barrels
French royal family that ruled France and other European countries
examples: He ordered bourbon on the rocks at the bar
Kentucky produces most of America's premium bourbon whiskey
The Bourbon dynasty ruled France until the French Revolution
Bourbon kings also governed Spain for several centuries

definitions: European term for stock exchange or securities market especially in France
examples: Traders gathered at the Paris Bourse to buy shares
The bourse opened with heavy trading in technology stocks

definitions: person who fights with fists in organized matches
medium-sized dog breed with square muzzle and short coat
loose-fitting men's underwear resembling shorts
examples: The professional boxer trained six hours every day
Both boxers showed excellent footwork during the championship match
Their boxer loved playing with children in the park
Boxers make loyal family pets despite their intimidating appearance
He preferred wearing boxers rather than briefs for comfort
The store offered boxers in various colors and patterns

definitions: creator god in Hinduism forming trinity with Vishnu and Shiva
examples: Devotees offered prayers to Brahma at the ancient temple
Brahma is often depicted with four faces representing cardinal directions

definitions: ultimate reality or universal spirit in Hindu philosophy
breed of cattle originating from India with distinctive hump
examples: Vedic texts describe Brahman as eternal and unchanging reality
Meditation helps seekers experience unity with Brahman directly
The Brahman cattle thrived in hot climates better than European breeds
Ranchers crossbred Brahman bulls to improve heat tolerance

definitions: member of highest Hindu caste traditionally serving as priests and teachers
member of social or intellectual elite especially in New England
examples: The Brahmin performed sacred rituals at the temple ceremony
Brahmins traditionally studied and taught ancient Sanskrit texts
Boston Brahmins dominated the city's cultural institutions for decades
The university attracted Brahmin families from across New England

definitions: system of raised dots read by touch enabling blind people to read and write
examples: She learned to read braille fluently within six months
The library offered hundreds of books printed in braille

definitions: native or inhabitant of Brazil, the largest country in South America
examples: The Brazilian dancers performed samba at the carnival celebration
Many Brazilians are passionate about soccer and beach volleyball

definitions: action or remark that insults or offends someone's dignity deliberately
examples: His public criticism was an affront to her professional reputation
They considered the ambassador's behavior an affront to their nation

definitions: native or inhabitant of Afghanistan in Central Asia
knitted or crocheted blanket with decorative patterns
tall slender dog breed with long silky coat
examples: The Afghan interpreter helped the peacekeeping forces communicate effectively
Many Afghans speak both Pashto and Dari languages
Grandmother crocheted a colorful afghan for the new baby
The wool afghan kept them warm during winter evenings
The Afghan hound gracefully ran across the show ring
Her Afghan required daily grooming to maintain its coat

definitions: basic monetary unit of Afghanistan divided into one hundred puls
examples: The market vendor quoted prices in afghani for local goods
Exchange rates showed one dollar equaled seventy afghanis yesterday

definitions: person who is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about particular subject or activity
examples: The wine aficionado could identify vintages by taste alone
Jazz aficionados gathered at the club every Thursday night

definitions: device in jet engine that injects fuel into exhaust gases for extra thrust
examples: The fighter pilot engaged afterburners to escape enemy missiles
Afterburners consume massive amounts of fuel but provide crucial speed

definitions: light remaining in sky after sunset or other bright light
pleasant feeling remaining after enjoyable experience
examples: The orange afterglow painted the western horizon beautifully
They watched the afterglow fade into darkness slowly
She basked in the afterglow of her successful performance
The afterglow of vacation lasted through their first workweek

definitions: life believed to continue after physical death in various religious and philosophical traditions
examples: Many religions promise rewards in the afterlife for virtuous living
Ancient Egyptians prepared elaborate tombs for the afterlife journey

definitions: consequences or aftereffects of significant unpleasant event especially disaster or conflict
examples: The aftermath of the hurricane left thousands homeless and jobless
Communities struggled to rebuild in the aftermath of war

definitions: smaller earthquake following main earthquake caused by adjustment of displaced crust
examples: Several aftershocks rattled the region days after the major quake
Scientists warned residents to expect aftershocks for several weeks

definitions: idea or item added later as less important addition to something already completed
examples: The garage seemed like an afterthought added to the house
She mentioned the promotion almost as an afterthought during dinner

definitions: highest form of love in Christian theology representing unconditional divine or brotherly love
examples: The sermon explored agape as selfless love for all humanity
Volunteers demonstrated agape through their tireless service to others

definitions: banded variety of chalcedony showing colorful layers used in jewelry and decoration
examples: The jeweler polished the agate to reveal its natural patterns
Collectors prized the rare blue agate from that region

definitions: succulent plant native to hot regions of Americas with rosette of thick fleshy leaves
examples: The agave plant bloomed once after growing for twenty years
Tequila producers harvest agave hearts to make their spirits

definitions: people who have lived for many years typically those past retirement age
examples: The community center offered special programs for the aged
Healthcare for the aged requires specialized training and patience

definitions: gradual process of becoming older involving physical and mental changes over time
examples: Scientists study ageing to understand how cells deteriorate gradually
Healthy lifestyle choices can slow the ageing process significantly

definitions: mass or collection of things gathered together in cluster or group
examples: The urban agglomeration expanded to include several neighboring towns
An agglomeration of small businesses formed around the transport hub

definitions: act of making problem or injury worse than before
thing that annoys or exasperates someone repeatedly
examples: Moving the injured shoulder caused further aggravation of the injury
The doctor warned against any aggravation of her condition
Traffic jams were a daily aggravation for suburban commuters
Dealing with bureaucracy became a major aggravation for him

definitions: whole formed by combining several separate elements
crushed stone or gravel used in making concrete
examples: The aggregate of small donations exceeded one million dollars
Scientists analyzed the aggregate data from multiple studies
The contractor ordered aggregate for the new parking lot
Different sizes of aggregate create various concrete textures

definitions: process of collecting units or parts into mass or whole
examples: Data aggregation helps researchers identify significant patterns clearly
The aggregation of clouds signaled an approaching storm system

definitions: website or program that collects related content from multiple sources into single location
examples: The news aggregator displayed headlines from hundreds of sources
Price aggregators help consumers find the best deals online

definitions: hostile or violent behavior intended to dominate or harm others physically or psychologically
examples: The therapist helped him manage his aggression through counseling
Unprovoked aggression against neighboring countries sparked international condemnation

definitions: person or country that attacks first or initiates hostilities without provocation
examples: The international court identified the aggressor in the conflict
Peacekeepers positioned themselves between victims and potential aggressors

definitions: ability to move quickly and easily with coordination and balance
examples: The gymnast's agility impressed judges at the Olympic trials
Soccer players need agility to change direction quickly while running

definitions: gradual process of becoming older involving physical and mental changes over time
examples: Research into aging focuses on maintaining quality of life
The aging population requires expanded healthcare and social services

definitions: state of anxiety or nervous excitement about something
act of stirring or shaking something vigorously
examples: Her agitation increased as the interview time approached rapidly
Political agitation led to massive protests in the capital
Constant agitation keeps the chemicals properly mixed in solution
The washing machine's agitation cycle lasted fifteen minutes

definitions: person who urges others to protest or rebel
mechanical device that stirs or shakes substances
examples: The political agitator organized strikes throughout the industrial district
Authorities arrested several agitators during the demonstration
The washing machine's agitator broke after years of use
Industrial agitators blend ingredients in large manufacturing tanks

definitions: person who believes nothing can be known about existence or nature of God
examples: The agnostic respected others' faith but remained personally unconvinced
Many scientists identify as agnostic rather than atheist

definitions: belief that existence of God or ultimate reality cannot be known or proven
examples: His agnosticism developed after years of philosophical study
Agnosticism differs from atheism by not denying God's possible existence

definitions: intense physical or mental suffering that causes great distress
examples: The athlete writhed in agony after tearing her knee ligament
Parents endured the agony of waiting for news about their missing child

definitions: open space in ancient Greek cities serving as marketplace and civic center
examples: Citizens gathered in the agora to debate political issues
Archaeologists uncovered ruins of the ancient agora beneath modern Athens
